sentence.text: Researchers have identified a subset of Holstein having a range of skeletal deformities, including vertebral anomalies, referred to as complex vertebral malformation due to mutations in the UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transmembrane transport gene.
Here, we report the first case in humans of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transmembrane transport-related vertebral anomalies.
Congenital disorders of glycosylation, including UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transmembrane transport-CDG, can present as a wide phenotypic spectrum, including skeletal dysplasia.
Previously reported patients with UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transmembrane transport-CDG have been described with syndromic autism, epilepsy, and arthrogryposis
